text: Hi FoodTube KerryAnn here

I'm gonna show you one of the quickest
and easiest recipes

it's a homemade houmous and I'm gonna
chop up some crunchy veg to dip in it
right
so to start I've got one of these food processors and I'm gonna put into it
two 400g cans of drained chickpeas
two tablespoons of tahini. Tahini is basically
just a sesame seed paste you can find it in most supermarkets

two fat cloves of garlic quick tip for
peeling garlic
nice and easy, get the back of your knife give it a short sharp whack and it should
just pop out of the skin like that
so in that goes. I love garlicky houmous but if you don't by all means you could just put
one clove in
the juice of half a lemon, try not to get any pips in
4 tablespoons of olive oil. Once I turn this on

the houmous is going to be made, this is
literally as easy as it gets
ready 123

right I'm gonna take the lid off and
scrape down the sides a little bit
just so everything gets blended all together. Come and have a look at this my friends
you'll see it's still looking quite thick quite chunky
at this stage by all means you can add
a couple tablespoons of cold water or even the juice from the rest of your lemon
and then I'm gonna turn it back on and whizz
it up a bit more. Now I like my houmous
quite smooth, a little bit of texture still to it and quite loose
however you like it, is how you can make it, if you like yours a little bit chunky

or even smoother than this, by all means
add a little bit more water, a little bit of oil

and a little bit more lemon it's
completely up to you, season it
with some salt and

a nice generous pinch of freshly ground
black pepper
and that's it my friends, I'm going to transfer this

to a nice little serving bowl and then
I'm gonna cut up ome
veg sticks and some bread to go with it
over here I've got some lovely carrots
Let's just take the tops off of these, chop off this little rooty bit at the bottom
and a great tip for making it look a little bit posh, is to stand your veg in some nice cute little glasses
Little bit of cucumber
just into nice chunky batons

you could use fresh peppers you could
use celery

anything that's crunchy really, cauliflowers
a weird one but it really works
and in the oven I've got some nice wholemeal pittas

warming through, my kids love this as an
after school snack

and I literally just cut these into
fingers as well
and then pile them up nicely
Just like that so there you have it my friends

my homemade houmous with crunchy
vegetables and wholemeal pitta. Give it a go.
Let me know how you get on in the comments box below if you flavor your houmous with
anything differently

if you do in a different way than I do
I'd love to hear from you
subscribe if you want it is free after all, for this recipe and loads more

check out my book, the links in the
description box and it'll take you straight where
you can buy it

but until then my friends have fun and
I'll see you next time
happy cooking
